results.title: Spring fever
results.brief_description: Introduced by scenes at Flemington in the 1860’s, preparations for the Melbourne Cup are shown, social sidelights and finally the running of the Centenary Melbourne Cup on 1st. November, 1960.

results.title: Grampians wonderland
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, David Swift and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description:
The Grampians mountain ranges rising from the plains of western Victoria were discovered by Major Mitchell and continue to delight tourists. This program shows the exquisite wildflowers, the animal life, the rugged mountain scenery and the foaming waterfalls which make the Grampians so beautiful and so popular. Winner of an AFI Award: 1959.

The convertable car used in this film is a Triumph TR3A.

results.title: All the love
results.brief_description: Shows the work of the Spastic Society of Victoria in the care and treatment of the cerebral palsied. Activities are designed to suit individual cases, always with the aim of fitting them for a normal life. Shows a variety of therapeutic treatments, and the organization of workshops within the Centres and under contract to outside companies.

results.title: The Siege of Barton's bathroom
results.brief_description: Elly Barton lives in a barren suburban housing estate where there is only one tree left standing. Now the neighbours want to cut it down, but what no-one seems to understand is that it is Elly’s tree - and she is not going to let anybody touch it. Stars Frankie J. Holden, Max Phipps and Rebekah Elmaloglou.

results.title: A Change of Pace
results.brief_description:
A film about the 1983 Australian Lawn Bowls Championship in Adelaide between Jeff Bradley and Jack Christey. Follows the lives of the players both at home and on the greens in the lead-up to the match.

The film begins and concludes with a promotion of the retirement services offered by the ANZ Bank.

results.title: Compilation The Angel and the rat
results.brief_description: The Angel and the rat (Melbourne, dir. Steve McDonald): Examines the ideas and lifestyle of Smiley Williams, a young sculptor. “Heart, head and hand” (dir. Peter Weir): Scenes from the life and work of Australian potter, Peter Rushforth. “Natural glass” (N.Z. dir. John King ; prod. Derek Wright); Looks at a one-man revival of natural glassmaking in New Zealand.

results.title: Computers in engineering
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Living with Computers”.
Martin Jones, a civil engineer, talks about the use of computers in engineering - a paper presented to the Junior World Computer Congress, Melbourne, October 1980.

results.title: Computing in the Aust. Dept. of Defence

Episode of Series “Living with Computers”.
An expert discusses the use of computers within the Australian Department of Defence, a paper presented to the Junior World Computer Congress, Melbourne, October 16-18 1980.
